comment: This was one of the most frustrating academic experiences I've ever had. The professor never returning graded work, leaving students in the dark. Unhelpful responses. The course is unorganized — lecture content lacked structure or continuity. Communication was backasswards. If you can avoid his class do so at all costs.

This is the worst professor I have ever had at this school. He is a terrible teacher, and expects you to know things he has not even covered yet. He grills everyone on their presentations, despite the fact that he gives no rubric. Avoid this professor at all costs
struggling very hard in his control systems class right now, does anyone have any tips or study materials for his first test?

Fairly easy class. Do the work & you'll be fine. Couple of assignments, modules, & final project/presentation. He is caring & funny. Calls students to discuss & assist with the final project. Great lectures. Hard to understand him when speaking. D2L content was disorganized & all over the place. Docked points for missing meetings =/

Took him for Circuits 2 and he explains nothing well. Everything is hard to understand unless u've already taken the class or more advanced classes. Assumes everyone remembers 100% of what they learned in Circuits 1 and doesn't take the time to go back an reteach anything. Also very disorganized and hard to keep track of.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Lecture heavy--Graded by few things

comment: Take his online summer course only if you're highly disciplined and can self-learn. Provided notes do not help. The textbook is awful and I recommend looking around for alternate sources for the material. There is also a semester long group project with two presentations- at midterm and finals week. Do the work, ask questions, and you will survive.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Group projects

comment: AWFUL. Prof was super nice, met with my group to help us complete our project but we struggled HARD. This was supposed to be an async onine class but the Prof had us meet once a week online AND come for 2 in-person labs (he later gave us a remote option instead). If you take him, pick a dumb easy project idea to or you'll struggle.

Very disorganized. He cares about his students, but is not good at teaching. Class always gets out late. There were no tests or quizzes, just 4 module assignments and a term project. He expects you to spend a lot of time on the term project. I didn't learn anything, just got more confused. There are 2 weeks left and still nothing has been graded.
rating_tags: Group projects--Graded by few things--Accessible outside class

comment: This has been the worst class I have ever taken. He does not teach at all and on top of that, did not finish the material for the class, so he uploaded "optional" lectures during Thanksgiving break and during finals week. Those optional lectures are required to complete the projects and to succeed in the class.

He is a nice guy BUT his class was extremely disorganized, we had no idea how to do most of the material, and he put off most of the class work to the end of the semester so something major was due every class period. To put it in perspective, our 2nd test had a 60 point curve. We even told him we had no idea what was happening and he didn't care
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Graded by few things--Group projects

comment: Dr C is very nice, gives good feedback and wants class to participate all the time. Sometimes his lectures are not very beginner friendly. I would suggest to look up the topic before attending lecture. Modeling project is really important for this class.

The only grades in Image Processing class are 5 small projects/homework and a final project. If you are comfortable with programming I suggest you take this course as it pushes EE students to be prepared for real life programming projects. You can either use Matlab or Python/opencv for the projects.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Accessible outside class--Graded by few things

comment: I want to like Chakravarty. He's one of the nicest professors I've ever had and he takes feedback from his students. The problem is that he treats his students like they already have lots of experience with controls. He doesn't know how to dumb down the material for beginners, and his lectures are impossible to follow. He's a lenient grader though.
rating_tags: Graded by few things--Test heavy--Group projects

comment: Dr. C ripped the joy of higher education from me. I loved college before taking him. If I could go back I would postpone my graduation date by a year just so I wouldn't have to take him. If you are looking to come out the other end of college feeling like you at least have a basic knowledge of the courses you took, avoid taking any class with Dr. C
This guy was a complete joke. I can't believe that he's still employed by any institution as a professor. Avoid taking him at all costs.

Worst professor I have ever had in any subject at any school. I can honestly tell you that I learned nothing from his class. He gave no worked out examples and his tests are insanely hard. He also does not under "pre-requisitions" and thinks every student in his class has already taken all calculus levels, diff equations, and circuits 2.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Test heavy--Group projects

comment: Chak if you read this the matlab assignments is too difficult for someone with no matlab experience, and your lecture is too fast. Way too many materials to cover with too little time.

Professor C had a pretty difficult time trying to cover the material in embedded systems but I believe it is because of how vast the material is. Don't fret because you can always reach him by e-mail or during office hours so if you put forth the effort you will do well. He grades fairly and is an outstanding professor in my book.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--GRADED BY FEW THINGS

comment: 50 min class with Chakravarty is probably the worst decision you can make. That isn't enough time for him. Get ready to stay late and have potential quiz/exam content thrown at you after class ends. His quizzes are 70% of your grade and you never really know what is on them.  He uses handwritten notes with no organization to them.A Last Resort Only
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Skip class? You won't pass.--TEST HEAVY

comment: Dr. C was often late to class, and had a habit of keeping us late to cover material (especially when next class was a quiz). Quizzes are a crapshoot: I made a 50 on two and 100 on another. You can ask for more points but it's hard to make a consistent grade. He likes end-of-term projects, so a good project (and group) will make or break your grade.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--TEST HEAVY--GROUP PROJECTS

comment: Prof. has difficulty covering the material in the class time, and jumps back and forth during his lectures. He rarely assigns homework and does not assign  readings. Several of his tests covered material we did not cover in class. He likes end-of-term projects, though, so if you do it well and come to every class you will probably (barely) pass.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--TEST HEAVY--GRADED BY FEW THINGS

comment: Dr. C is very caring and intelligent. I would love to work for or with him on a research project. However, he is terrible at communicating information effectively. I never knew what was going on in the class. The average of each test was well below 50. He changed his teaching style several times in orde to try to combat this, but it was uneffective
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.
